intro: Asyneuma persicum, commonly known as Persian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Asyneuma persicum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various ailments.
